thread.title: Greek Government Repays Samurai Bond Due Today, Debt Agent Says
thread.title_full: Greek Government Repays Samurai Bond Due Today, Debt Agent Says - Bloomberg Business

author: Finbarr Flynn
title: Greek Government Repays Samurai Bond Due Today, Debt Agent Says
text:
The Greek government repaid a Samurai bond maturing Tuesday, according to Mizuho Financial Group Inc., which is acting as the agent for the note.
Masako Shiono, a spokeswoman for Mizuho, confirmed the repayment. The outstanding amount was 11.67 billion yen ($94 million), according to data compiled by Bloomberg. The price of the securities fell to 44.73 yen against par on July 10, compared with 80.35 yen on June 1, the data show.
Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras on Monday surrendered to European demands for immediate action to qualify for as much as 86 billion euros ($94.4 billion) of aid needed to keep his country in the currency union. Greece is running out of money and its banks have been shut for the the past two weeks.
